intro: Sclerochiton scissisepalus, commonly known as the split-sepaled sclerochiton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
